thread.title: Tennessee bats erupt to take series at Memphis
thread.title_full: Tennessee bats erupt to take series at Memphis

title: Tennessee bats erupt to take series at Memphis
text:
Tennessee bats erupt to take series at Memphis Vols allow just two hits, use seven-run second inning to drop Tigers   Tennessee sophomore pitcher Will Neely (Photo: Tennessee athletics, UTSports.com) 
Tennessee baseball used a seven-run second inning, allowed just two hits and used six shutout innings from starting pitcher Will Neely in a 10-0 win over Memphis Sunday at FedEx Park in Memphis, helping the Vols win the weekend series. 
Benito Santiago, Andre Lipcius and Dom Thornton each had two RBI in the win and Neely gave up just one hit and struck out two over his six innings of work. 
(Want the latest scoop on Tennessee football and basketball? Make sure you're in the loop â€” take five seconds to sign up for our FREE Vols newsletter now!) 
Garrett Stallings, Andrew Schultz and Jon Lipinski each pitched an inning in relief, combining to give up just one hit while striking out two and issuing no walks. 
Thornton doubled to put Tennessee up 1-0 in the second inning and the Vols followed with seven more hits in the inning to blow the game open. 
Tennessee (2-1) now travels to Los Angeles, Calif., to face Loyola Marymount at 9 p.m. Wednesday, before a three-day stay at the Tony Gwynn Classic in San Diego. 
The Vols' home-opener at Lindsey Nelson Stadium is March 3 against Norfolk State.
